responses: Hello!
Hi, what would you like to know about Rocket League?

Bonjour!
I am a ChatBot that likes to talk about the video game Rocket League. Ask me anything about Rocket League!
You can ask what Rocket League is, how the game is played, who plays it professionally, which platforms support Rocket League, etc.

patterns: Hey, my name is George Lucas
My family says I am Stacy
I hate my name, it's Karen
What do you know about me
What have you saved about me
I've never heard of Rocket League before.
Can you give me more details.
responses: Rocket League is a vehicular soccer video game developed and published by Psyonix. The game was first released for Microsoft Windows and PlayStation 4 in July 2015, with ports for Xbox One and Nintendo Switch being released later on.

patterns: How many players does it support?
How many controllers can you play with?
Can I play with my friends?
responses: Rocket League supports both local and online multiplayer for up to 8 people in a single game. It's a great game to play with your friends!

patterns: who are the pro Rocket League plays?
Who is the best at Rocket League?
Who is the best at it?
responses: Some of the best Rocket League players include Pierre “Turbopolsa” Silfver, Alexandre “Kaydop” Courant, Garrett “GarrettG” Gordon, Remco “Remkoe” den Boer, Francesco “kuxir97” Cinquemani, and Cameron “Kronovi” Bills.

Described as 'soccer, but with rocket-powered cars', Rocket League has up to eight players assigned to each of the two teams, using rocket-powered vehicles to hit a ball into their opponent's goal and score points over the course of a match. The game includes single-player and multiplayer modes which can be played both locally and online, including cross-platform play between all versions

patterns: What platforms can you play it on?
Where can you play Rocket League?
responses: Rocket League is now free to play on all major consoles including the Switch, Xbox, Playstation, and PC! You should download it and give it a shot!
While Rocket League was originally developed by a company called Psyonix, it is now owned and operated by Epic Games, the same people who distribute Fortnite!

patterns: I can't believe epic bought out rocket league, it made the game worse.
responses: Right? Epic Games is the worst. They ruined Rocket League :(

patterns: What game modes are there in Rocket League?
What are the different types of games in Rocket League?
How can you play Rocket League?
responses: Rocket League has many different modes you can try out. The classics include 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, and 4v4 chaos mode. Some of the more playful modes are Dropshot, Hoops, Snow Day, and Rumble.

patterns: Can you tell me more about Rumble?
responses: Rumble is a variant of Rocket League where you are assigned powerups at random. These powerups include a boxing glove to smash the ball, freezing the ball, teleporting with other plays, a tractor beam that sucks the ball toward you, and a plunger for grabbing the ball.

patterns: Can you tell me more about Dropshot?
responses: Dropshot is a variant of Rocket League where the goal is underneath the ground. As you hit the ground with the ball, holes open up where you are then able to score. It's a lot of fun!

patterns: Can you tell me more about Dropshot?
responses: Hoops is a classic. Hoops is very similar to Basketball. There are two hoops at either of the court which you attempt to dunk the ball into from above. A skilled hoops player can make some pretty awesome plays!

patterns: Can you tell me more about Snowday?
responses: Snow Day is a hockey variant of Rocket League. Instead of playing with a ball, you play with a puck that slides around on the ice. Snow Day is hard, but if you can handle the puck then you can make some great plays!

patterns: Is there an eSports scene for Rocekt League
Are there tournaments for Rocket League?
Is eSports important in Rocket League?
responses: Psyonix had observed the popularity of Rocket League matches on Twitch and other live streaming platforms, and in February 2016, were looking to use the game more in esports. In March 2016, Psyonix announced the first Rocket League Championship Series; the finals took place in August 2016 with a $55,000 prize pool. More than $1 million in revenues from the sale of in-game crates and cosmetic items were used to fund additional competitive events throughout the year, including smaller competitions at major gaming conventions and support for community-run competitive events. Rocket League is very important in the eSports scene.

patterns: Where can I get Rocket League?
responses: On PC, you can download Rocket League on Steam. Otherwise, be sure to check out your consoles store and I'm sure you can pick up Rocket League there. Have fun playing!
